private_information: I know the initial arrangement of disks on the pegs.
Initial state: left peg has disks from top to bottom A B C D E F G H, middle peg is empty, right peg is empty.
disk_manager.goal: Move the entire stack of disks from the left peg to the right peg maintaining disk ordering rules.

private_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are eight disks labeled A B C D E F G H where A is the smallest and H is the largest.
Legal moves: move exactly one top disk from one peg to another peg, and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
rule_expert.goal: Provide the legal move constraints and invariants necessary to solve the Tower of Hanoi instance.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate inputs from other agents and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards solver that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 8 disks labeled A B C D E F G H from smallest (A) to largest (H).
Move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller one.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top to bottom) A B C D E F G H, middle peg is empty, right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg empty, middle peg empty, right peg has (top to bottom) A B C D E F G H.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an agent responsible for describing the instance initial state and any object naming conventions. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a clear, concise description of the initial peg contents and disk labels that another agent can consume.
analysis.prompt: Your name is disk_manager. You see the public information about the Tower of Hanoi instance and you have private knowledge of the initial arrangement. Provide a precise description of the initial state, listing each peg and its stack top to bottom, and any naming conventions for disks and pegs. Do not produce PDDL. Keep the description explicit and unambiguous.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an agent that encodes the domain constraints and invariants of the Tower of Hanoi problem in natural language. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on the allowed actions, preconditions, and invariants that must hold during planning.
analysis.prompt: Your name is rule_expert. Using the public information and your private knowledge of the rules, enumerate the legal move types, preconditions for moving a disk, and invariants such as disk ordering constraints. Provide this information in a structured natural language format that an orchestrator can convert into PDDL. Do not produce PDDL yourself.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert that must synthesize a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards planner. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model the 8-disk Tower of Hanoi instance. Keep agent actions and object names consistent with the inputs. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards conventions.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the descriptions from disk_manager and rule_expert to produce a full PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that solve the Tower of Hanoi instance where all disks start on the left peg and must be moved to the right peg. Use object names for disks A through H and pegs left, middle, right. Ensure move operators prevent placing larger disks on smaller ones and enforce moving one top disk at a time. Output the domain and problem as requested and target the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
